data.title: tonyb2015
data.meta_description: Read all of the posts by tonyb2015 on The Cuban Bridge
data.text:
SENT BY PIANIST DIANE MARINO

WELCOME TO SAMBUCA NASHVILLE

“If you’re in Nashville this week you should definitely make your way to Sambuca. We have one of the city’s finest week day happy hours paired with a delicious nightly dinner and a show!

Then on the weekends, enjoy brunch with a side of live music.

Sambuca… Come to dine, stay to dance”.

http://www.dianemarino.com

http://www.nashville.sambucarestaurant.com

Havana, Cuba native, Florida resident, José Armando Gola studied at the Amadeo Roldán Conservatory of Music, and began playing bass since age 13, inspired to pursue a career by his father bassist and guitarist Armando “Andy” Gola, leader of Timba Groups Layé and Colé Colé, and former member of Los Takson Rock Group in the 1960s, El Combo Los Barba, Elio Revé y su Charangón, and La 440 Orchestra.

He plays both upright and electric bass and has toured internationally and performed at many major jazz festivals.

From his home in Florida “The Sunshine State”, El Gola Jr., has worked with Gonzalo Rubalcaba Trio and The Volcán Quartet for more than seven years.

Gola has appeared on Grammy-nominated and Grammy winner albums by Francisco Céspedes, Arturo Sandoval, Gonzalo Rubalcaba, Alejandro Sanz, and Ignacio Berroa.

He has also recorded on albums led by Hector Martignon, Eldar Djamgirov, Raúl Di Blasio, Felipe Lamoglia, Team V.I.P, Marisela Verena, Mayra Casales, José Conde, his sister Thalía (in a band led by his father Andy), Eckroth + Lamothe 6, Andy Gola & Colé Colé, Jennifer López, Luis Enrique, The Chucho Valdés and Paquito D’Rivera Sextet, with Chucho Valdés Royal Quartet, and many others.

His first album as a leader with 9 original songs is entitled “Live Things” (2008), and features Tony Pérez (keys), Felipe Lamoglia (saxophones), Mike Rodríguez (trumpet), Ludwig Alfonso (drums), Rafael Solano and Philbert Armenteros (miscelaneous percussion), and William Paredes (trombone).

Gonzalo Rubalcaba (piano) and Ignacio Berroa (drums) appear as special guests.

You can find this, and two others on Spotify!

Gola Akoustic (2019), and Gola Elektrik (2021).

ELEVEN YEARS OF IMPACT AS A LEADER … AND IN RECENT DAYS …

I saw El Gola Jr., playing with Chucho Valdés Royal Quartet on Thursday, July 6, au Théâtre Maisonneuve, Place des Arts, as part of The Montreal International Jazz Festival 2023, in its 43rd edition!

On drums, Horacio “El Negro” Hernández and Roberto Junior Vizcaino on a percussion set.

This dynamic Quartet made the MIJF memorable!

They will be in my TV show Havana Fairfax Connection @ LCATV in Colchester, Vermont, USA in two weeks!

Thank you for watching.

http://lcatv.org/havana-fairfax-connection

Welcome back to LCATV Channel 1075 in Colchester, Vermont!

Today, I’m honored to introduce you to one of the new, upcoming musicians, that is hitting the jazz scene today.

Her name is Virginia MacDonald, she was born and raised in Toronto, Canada.

Clarinetist Virginia MacDonald has been called “a powerful new voice in the Canadian jazz scene” by Juno Award bassist Mike Downes.

At the age of 27, Virginia has established herself as a respected and sought after musician in the Toronto music scene.

She has performed extensively as both a leader and a side woman, across the city, as well as in historic and prestigious venues. And this year, she will also play in NY, Montreal and South Carolina.

Clarinetist Virginia MacDonald has performed in several International Jazz Festivals.

And on Saturday, July 8, at The Montreal International Jazz Festival leading her own Quartet with drummer Valerie Lacombe, guitarist Sam Kirmayer, and bass legend Ira Coleman.

Virginia has played here in the U.S, and also in Germany, India, Austria, Spain, France and the UK, as part of The Canadian Jazz Collective.

In 2019, Virginia was selected as a recipient of the Stingray Rising Star Award at the Toronto Jazz Festival.

And in 2020, was selected as the first-prize winner of the International Clarinetist Corona Competition;

judges included revered clarinetists Anat Cohen, Victor Goines, Doreen Ketchens and Ken Peplowski!.

At this point in her career, Virginia MacDonald is focusing on composing and performing her own music, giving them a great amount of thought!.

As her playing and improvising skills are top-notch, she played with

The Ostara Project – the All Female Canadian Jazz Supergroup back in the fall, and continues playing with most of the Ostara members in different settings.

Saxophonist Allison Au (of Ostara) and Virginia, just made an album with a really great Canadian piano player Will Bonness, which was just released in June.

Headed to break new grounds in this music genre, Virginia has recorded in 14 albums !

Feel welcomed to find her full discography and performances on her website:

http://www.virginiamacdonald.ca

Last but not least, I want to let you know that Virginia is the daughter of acclaimed saxophonist Kirk MacDonald, who has received more than 19 Awards and Nominations as a jazz musician and educator!

Born in 1959, Kirk MacDonald has been recognized as one of Canada’s leading saxophonist for over 35 years, leading his own Quartets & Quintets, co-leading The Canadian Jazz Collective and The Kirk MacDonald Big Band !

Jazz is Healthy and Alive!

Jazz was born in the US of America and is enjoyed all over the world!

And Canada, is the best example of this!

Don’t pay attention to those who say that Jazz is Dead! Because it’s not!

On the other side of the set, another jazz lover – Rebecca Padula, LCATV Channel Coordinator, and musician, always helping me in the production of more that 135 HFC episodes, since June 2017!

If this is not a record, it’s a good average!

Now is your time to enjoy, don’t move the Channel and don’t go anywhere!

Thank you very much for having us !

http://lcatv.org/havana-fairfax-connection
